node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.alt: This building in Brooklyn Heights has 11 apartments, five of which are rent-stabilized.Â
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
node.content: ["$5.3 MILLION", "68 Middagh Street (between Hicks and Henry Streets)", "Brooklyn", "This 9,156-square-foot, five-story apartment building in Brooklyn Heights was built in 1900 and has 11 apartments: two studios and nine two-bedrooms. Five of the apartments are rent-stabilized and two are vacant.", "Buyer: 177 Water Limited Partnership", "Seller: 68 Middagh Street L.L.C.", "Brokers: Michael Salvatico, Robbie Ferman and Shaun Riney of Marcus & Millichap", "$27 MILLION", "792 Sterling Place (between Rogers and Nostrand Avenues)", "Brooklyn", "Built in 2009, this five-story, 61,000-square-foot building in Crown Heights has 82 apartments: 30 studios, 34 one-bedrooms and 18 two-bedrooms, all of which are rent-stabilized. The building is fully occupied and includes a laundry room, a fitness room and a parking lot with 58 spaces.", "Seller: Sterling Place Condo", "Broker: Lev Mavashev of Alpha Realty", "$43.5 MILLION", "251-73 Jericho Turnpike (at Little Neck Parkway)", "Queens", "This four-story, 80,102-square-foot building in Bellerose was built in 2018 and has 16 commercial units. The building is 98 percent leased, with anchor tenants that include Planet Fitness, Children of America, Tiger Schulmann\u2019s, SightMD, Northwell Health and Finesse Dental Lab.", "Seller: Jericho Holdings", "Brokers: Stephen R. Preuss, Kevin Schmitz, Kevin Louie and Andreas Efthymiou of Ripco Real Estate"]
